alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 18 at 4:44AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of West Tennessee, including the following county, Shelby. * WHEN...Until 600 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 444 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bartlett, Collierville, Germantown, Cordova, T O Fuller State Park, Memphis, Lakeland, Arlington, Southeast Memphis, Midtown Memphis, Frayser, Ellendale, Downtown Memphis, Whitehaven, Southwest Memphis, White Station, Parkway Village, Raleigh, Elmore Park and Capleville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
